headline: Hannity: CNN's creepy new obsession
subHeadline: The network devotes hours of breathless coverage to salacious accusations against the president.

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: All right, Tucker. Great show as always. And welcome to 'Hannity.'  Breaking tonight, I have said it before, I will say it again and prove it, journalism -- so-called journalism in this country is dead and this weekend you witnessed just one more if not the final nail in the coffin. Well, now that the media's Russia obsession isn't exactly working out according to plan, well, instead of Russia, Russia, Russia, well, now, it's Stormy, Stormy, Stormy and more Stormy.  The mainstream media's non-stop assault on President Trump and his character and credibility has reached an even new low.  And then there's creepy Anderson Cooper along with the king of porn, soon to be scandal plagued Jeff Zucker fake news CNN, they're all leading the way. Tonight, we will show you, get your tape recorders running how this breathless hysteria surrounding Stormy Daniels exposes the blatant double standard within your mainstream media. And we'll give you our take on Stormy Daniels and the much hyped interview on '60 Minutes' last night.  Plus, despite the press in this country telling you would never happen, President Trump he is taking tough swift action against Russia expelling diplomats some of whom are spies from our borders and closing Russia's consulate in Seattle. We have that and more you do not want to miss our breaking news opening monologue.

SAVANNAH GUTHRIE, NBC I asked you whether there was any evidence, documentary evidence, text messages, photo evidence that that verified that Stormy Daniels had the affair she claims that she had. You said to me that's a question that Ms. Daniels will have to ultimately answer. Look at this, CNN was running images all day long, oh there she is, porn star Stormy Daniels next to Karen McDougal. We're not making this up. There's a serious note to all this. And aside from Anderson's usually salacious interviews, the mainstream media's coverage of Daniels and McDougal is revealing a huge double standard in this country. You got allegations from a porn star about a one-time consensual relationship with Donald Trump gets round-the-clock coverage, CNN, NBC, ABC, CBS conspiracy TV MSNBC and others. According to a study -- this is where we get serious -- from Newsbusters, between March 7th and March 25th, the evening newscast from just NBC, ABC, and CBS while they dedicated a whopping 40 minutes of airtime to Trump allegations of a consensual relationship. But for decades, the mainstream media has completely ignored serious stories of abuse. Juanita Broaddrick, Paula Jones, Kathleen Willey, all women that accused a former president, Bill Clinton, of serial predator like gross sexual misconduct, and the Media Research Center, they crunch those numbers. And according to their count, 1994, when Paula Jones came forward with details about Bill Clinton dropping his pants and exposing himself to her in a hotel room, CBS and NBC actually ignored the story. And then in 1997, when Kathleen Willey's allegations about Bill Clinton became public, that he groped and grabbed and fondled and touched and kissed her against her will, oh, CBS and NBC gave it one minute and 34 seconds of coverage, ABC didn't touch the story. But CNN's evening newscast dedicated just 26 seconds of coverage -- being different CNN then and now. And meanwhile, Lisa Myers from NBC, she booked the first interview with Juanita Broaddrick, and according to a report from 'The Washington Post', for over a month, NBC chief Andy Lack and others prevented the interview from airing because they said they were unable to corroborate her story. Right here on the Fox News Channel, Brit Hume, remember and others, were wearing free Lisa Myers buttons on air to encourage NBC to release that extremely important interview. When the mainstream media eventually did cover the stories of Bill Clinton's accusers, the reporting was often dismissive. Let's take a look at some of the clips provided to us, thanks to the Media Research Center.

utterances.sentences: We don't even know what Trump had done for.

utterances.sentences: Here with more investigative reporter John Solomon and Campbell's attorney Victoria Toensing, a Fox News contributor, and investigative reporter Sara Carter and Greg Jarrett also with us. utterances.speaker: JOHN SOLOMON, VICE PRESIDENT, THE HILL
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's very, very important. If you start what we started a few months ago we believe that there was one red flag, one reason for Barack Obama not to give all this uranium to the Russians in the forms of billions of dollars of contract the Uranium One sale. He approved all those things. We know for the first time that he also was passing along a second red flag. Russia, ROSATOM was assisting Iran's illicit nuclear program. He gave very specific details. And tonight after my story broke I got a call from some intelligence sources they gave me a little bit more information. Doug Campbell was providing information about the Bushehr Nuclear Power Plant in Iran. Russia was helping that specifically plant. Why is that important? The U.S. was so concerned about that they eventually unleashed the Stuxnet virus for Israel targeting that very plant. So it was a place we were very concerned about. Doug Campbell was telling the Obama administration early on this is a problem.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So, wait a minute. So what we are saying here, Sara, is that Campbell identifying this specific nuclear Russian plant, nuclear plant, the Iranian nuclear plant, but the Russians are helping. Now that goes into the Obama deal to give them all of that money. That goes into Campbell knew all this 18 months before they signed off on the Uranium One deal? They knew about all the crimes.

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, CONTRIBUTOR, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think this is what's so important here, Sean for people to remember historically. When the Obama administration in 2010 decided to reset with Russia, they basically pulled away the sanctions that have been put in place by the Bush administration. And when they did that, it opened the gateway. It allowed the Russians to enter our uranium market, our energy market. But at the same time it allowed the Russians to continue working with the Iranians. And at that point in time, I mean, that Campbell was providing all of this information the Obama administration was well aware of it. And not only that, it also opened up the door for the SR-300 missiles, their defensive missiles that the Russians were going to sell and did sell to Iran so that they could defend these power plants that we were so intent on finding more information about these nuclear reactors that we believe they were using for their nuclear program. Not just for medical use but to build missiles to build war heads. And these nuclear power plants were so important at that time to our congressional leaders that they didn't want these any of these plants to go through. That's why there were so many people fighting the Uranium One deal.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We are talking about, Victoria, the most important aspects of America's national security. The expelled Russians will have just seven days to leave this country and while President Trump takes serious action against Russia on something we didn't see until the final weeks of the Obama administration you might remember when the mainstream media was predicting that Donald Trump would do the exact opposite, that President Trump was some kind of shill for Vladimir Putin, or Brennan saying last week, oh, maybe they've got something on Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BRENNAN, FORMER CIA DIRECTOR
utterances.utterance: I think he's afraid of the president of Russia.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: BRENNAN
utterances.utterance: Well, I think one could speculate as to why that the Russians may have something on him personally, that they could always roll out and make his life more difficult.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAM COHAN, VANITY FAIR SPECIAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: It's so clear at this point that Vladimir Putin and his associates, somebody has something on Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: That may be something that turns the key on the Russia probe, is figuring out why this president is so deferential to Putin and to Russia. And if there is some sort of kompromat that they have on him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Donald Trump is afraid a political hurricane is out there at sea for him. We'll call it hurricane Vladimir, if you will, the whole Russian thing.

utterances.speaker: SCARBOROUGH
utterances.utterance: They make these decisions time and time again in a way that makes it appear that they're hostages, that he's Vladimir Putin's hostage.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm back to disagreeing with liberal Joe. You just heard it. Former CIA Director Brennan said the Russians must have something on Trump, OK, then if they did, why would he do what he did today? I wonder if the media's going to publicly eat those words, but don't hold your breath. If the media's obsession with Russia, Russia, Russia followed by their new obsession with Stormy, Stormy, Stormy has taught us anything, it's that when the media is wrong, they'll just move on to another story, never mind.

utterances.speaker: And our next guest, Monica Crowley, wrote an op-ed in 'The Hill' today titled
utterances.utterance: The voters care about Trump's sexual history, ask Bill Clinton. She joins us, now along with CRTV host Michelle Malkin. You were saying something to me, I can't wait for Saturday Night Live.

utterances.speaker: MONICA CROWLEY, LONDON CENTER FOR POLICY RESEARCH
utterances.utterance: Well, watching those clips which are frankly embarrassing now in the me too era, everybody who made those comments excusing Bill Clinton's behavior, abhorrent behavior, allegations of rape and sexual assault and sexual harassment, they ought to be extremely embarrassed. But all of this hysterical coverage over Stormy Daniels, you know, we all know sex sells. OK, that's part of it. But this breathless coverage looks like a 'Saturday Night Live' skit and the point, Sean, is that they are so desperate to try to get Trump on anything. And now that the Russian collusion story is falling apart, at least with regards to Trump and his team, it's certainly in play with Hillary Clinton in the DNC and the Democrats. But now that that line is falling apart, they've got to come up with a new narrative. So what they're doing with Stormy Daniels it's not about the consensual sex from over a decade ago. They're trying to nail him on some sort of violation of campaign finance law. They're dying for a Trump stag tape to come out at some point that they can roll anything to embarrass and use as a weapon against Donald Trump they will find.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Michelle, I think Monica's had a lot of good points. One that really stood out is in the era of Me-Too, the treatment of Juanita and Paula who'll join us, Kathleen Willey and others, in retrospect but it wasn't that long ago because they defended the Clintons through 2016, November of 2016. Your reaction?

utterances.speaker: MICHELLE MALKIN, 'MICHELLE MALKIN INVESTIGATES' HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's right. And, you know, Monica's piece was fantastic. And, Sean, I listened to your interview earlier this afternoon on radio with Juanita Broaddrick I can't wait to see her on the channel speaking truth as she has for all of these years, as all of these media hypocrites turn their nose up at her, who were enablers for the victim smearing machine of the Clintons. And so, it is not past history as I said before as we've talked about before to bring up that hypocrisy and make them confront it. What CNN and CBS are guilty of is softcore journalism driven by a hardcore obsession to bring this president down. The greatest hypocrisy and Monica knows this well because we've lived it as conservative women in public for 20, 25, 30 years, is that when these Me-Too radical feminists say believe all women, there is a massive exception in that rule, and that is never believe a conservative woman or a Republican woman who is turning the tables and exposing the sexual predation of Democratic and liberal men.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It is such a difference in topics and Monica, I'll throw this to you. In other words, his is over a dozen years ago. We're talking about consensual -- both women, Karen McDougal and Stormy Daniels, both women say it's consensual. Then you compare it to rape, groping, grabbing, touching, fondling, kissing against Kathleen as well, Paula Jones and dropping his pants, and they did everything they could do to ignore it, and not hold Hillary accountable for defending him.

utterances.speaker: CROWLEY
utterances.utterance: Well, that's exactly right. I mean, the double standard is glaring, but the idea that the leftist media would think that the Stormy Daniels or Karen McDougal stories are going to stick and somehow damage Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, who they aided and abetted all those years ago and continued to do so, by the way, he rewrote the playbook on this. He taught the American voter, taught the American people not to regard this with kind of thing with any kind of real importance, right? To treat it as irrelevant. What happens in a presidential bedroom where before a man becomes president stays in the bedroom, right, especially if it's consensual. We're not talking about non-consensual here. He rewrote the rules here and now Donald Trump is saying, look, he's not saying anything. He's being defended. This is a long-ago thing. So, if we want to apply the rules that Bill Clinton put into place, well, why not? Then it should be the same standard.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And in fairness, Ed Bradley did interview I believe Kathleen and Paul. In fairness, he worked with '60 Minutes', he was a great reporter over the years I have a lot of good things to say about him. But the tawdry aspects, I don't -- am I wrong and just thinking Anderson Cooper is creepy and when I'm comparing him to Jerry Springer. It's that's what I'm reminded of is America understanding this, 22 million people watched last night, huge number, Michelle, but I suspect it was out of curiosity more than anything else.

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: Well, yes. I mean, I think it was sort of like a rubber necking and in front of a train wreck. And, you know, you can put your smart glasses on and have this veneer of gravitas. But in essence, Anderson Cooper is no different than Stormy Daniels and being a striptease exhibitionist.

utterances.speaker: CROWLEY
utterances.utterance: And you know what, there's one other thing and I agree with everything that Michelle said. There's one other thing, the way it boomeranged and actually helped Bill Clinton survive impeachment and there was sort of a rallying around the president, same thing that's going to happen here. People tuned in last night because it was salacious --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But, you know, they were also going to see the biggest abuse of power --

utterances.speaker: CROWLEY
utterances.utterance: Actually helps Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Are we going to start asking questions about so-called journalists and every detail of their lives?

utterances.speaker: CROWLEY
utterances.utterance: Well, they would not want the spotlight, Sean. Wouldn't they?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And then you say that's over the line, wouldn't they? Oh, I'm sure.

utterances.speaker: CROWLEY
utterances.utterance: Listen, this country has serious problems. The country elected Donald Trump to deal with them. They could care less about a story like that. They want the president to deal with our issues.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm pretty sure I've made a lot of friends in the industry tonight. I'd like to say welcome all of you. Thanks for watching. Appreciate it. All right. This show's far from over. When we come back, a 'Hannity' exclusive. Paula Jones and Juanita Broaddrick, they react to this gross hypocrisy and how their allegations of sexual misconduct against Bill Clinton were ignored by many of these same people. That's next, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And joining us now with reaction to our opening monologue, two women who did accuse the President Bill Clinton of sexual misconduct and being a predator, Paula Jones and Juanita Broaddrick. Good to see both. It's great to have. Now, you have a new book that has come out. I actually have a copy of it here because you forgot to bring me -- I haven't

utterances.speaker: JUANITA BROADDRICK, AUTHOR, 'YOU BETTER PUT SOME ICE ON THAT'
utterances.utterance: Oh, here, I've got it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You got it, OK. This is it. 'You Better Put Some Ice On That: How I Survived Being Raped by Bill Clinton'.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Now, what's amazing about this is, have you ever been interviewed on '60 Minutes'?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, never. Or CNN, or MSNBC.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes, there it is. Yes. You've never been interviewed by CNN.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: MSNBC.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Never.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: '60 Minutes'.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Never.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And it was hard to get it on NBC with Lisa Myers who I know wanted to air her interview with you.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And I have said this to you. In all my years I'm now 23 years at Fox and 30 years in radio, your interview and you actually write about some of this in the book, it was the hardest interview I have ever done?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: That's right, and you were the second interview that I had done and the last. Of course there was Dorothy Rubin (Ph) with him in between. But when you came to my home with all of your people and sat down, I never thought about this being as emotional to you as it, you know, as it was to me. But we sat down and I begin to tell you the horrific events.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It was a brutal rape?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes. When I began to tell you about that, I turned and looked at you at one time and he had tears in his eyes. And it just -- it almost, it just overwhelmed me. You have always been so good to us and I appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, one thing that Lisa Myers said to you when she said we can't air the interview right now. She said, well, I have two good news and bad news. You are credible.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're too -- you're too credible.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And this whole title you better put some ice on that. It's from the story. He raped you and when he was done he told you because he had bit your lip?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes, he bit my lip to keep me quiet. But the time he was leaving the room, calmly puts on his sunglasses and motions to my lip, and says you better put some ice on that and coldly walks out the door.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You had the experience. You won your lawsuit?

utterances.speaker: PAULA JONES, BILL CLINTON ACCUSER
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You got a judgment in your paper, a settlement?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: If you ask the liberals though, no, absolutely not.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. You won a lot of money too.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. And, but he exposed himself, he I guess noticed you, invited you in a hotel room and he dropped his pants.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's my question. You watched the interview with Stormy Daniels, right?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. And you see the breathless hysteria of the coverage.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, insane.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: When you compare Juanita's story your stories Kathleen Willey is not here to claim--

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: There is no comparison. You know what, Mr. Trump if he did that, you know what, it was not a crime. He didn't -- he did not do something that was a crime. There is a difference there. She admitted he didn't do anything to hurt that hurt her or whatever. You know, she was a willing participant. And it's so different but we did not get the kind of coverage that she is getting. It is outrageous.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Not even close.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: We were made fun of, we were about, we were on late night talk shows, you know, making fun of us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Constantly?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes, it was constant.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: It was horrible. Absolutely. We were never -- yes. Remember, James Carville, you know, during that $100 bill--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Dollar bill to a trailer park.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, absolutely, I have never lived in a trailer park but, you know, I mean, that's the way they treated us. And this was a serious thing. And you know, that even through Hillary Clinton's election, she never ever was asked anything about us women. Never. She doesn't care.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You remember when she said women have a right to be heard?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, and to believe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And to believe.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And having interviewed both of you and Kathleen in the past.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I remember saying, does that mean we believe Juanita now?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Does that mean we believe Marla--

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Absolutely not! After I tweeted what I did on January 6th, she calmly removed you should be believed from her web site.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You tweeted last night at Anderson Cooper and 60 Minutes.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you tweeted, would you like to interview me about my book?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You heard from Anderson? You had been with Anderson?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: No, but I am not a porn star. I was a hard working nurse and a business woman. You know, I was a nurse.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You were a nurse.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: You know, I was, and I was a hardworking person, but I wasn't a porn star. So I guess that's why they weren't interested in me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think it was because of politics and the idea is I've always talked about this president having five big groups against him. We got the deep state. We talk about that a lot. You got the liberal media, you got Democrats and Republicans and never Trumpers. It seems like if you are a Democrat me too doesn't matter. It seems if you're a Democrat, women's rights don't matter. And you two are living examples of it.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I'll let you--

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: I know. I know. It's just like when they contacted me to do an interview for the Me Too long before we knew they were going to be person of the year, I told them I did not feel a part of that. Because no one had ever included me in that. And this was Charlotte Alter from Time magazine.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You were me too long before me too and you were brutalized.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: I know. And they asked me to submit a comment to them which I said OK, I will in support of the Me Too, and then all of the sudden they came out as being person of the year. And I looked for my comment and it wasn't there.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes. Me too before -- what do you say to all of those people that are act so sanctimonious and so -- they're fanning such outrage over two allege consensual relationship?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Exactly. Well, you know, it's because they are trying to get Donald Trump out of office and they are going to do everything they can, that is my opinion that they are going to do everything they can to try and impeach him or you know, try to drag out step about him that he's going to--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is this what it's now about though, is it now we want every detail of every consensual relationship going back a dozen years of every politician?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Only if it's -- only if it's the Republicans.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Not the democrats?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. Yes, no, it's not about that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes. Was it hard seeing all of this? And then does it bring up memories from both of you of what you all went through?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Sure. It never goes away. I tweeted that one time, you know, back in 2016. It's something. It's likely less we said today when you have been victimized as horrifically as I was it's in your DNA. You do not forget it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. I want to thank you. Good to see both.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Paula started a coffee company that swears I'm going to lose weight so she gave us some coffee.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you. This book by the way you can get it on Amazon.com, Hannity.con and I guess in book stores or Amazon.com?

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Noble, what is it, Barnes & Noble.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Can I tell them my web site?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: It's Paula's weight loss coffee.com.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: And you can contact me on Facebook at Paula Jones.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you, both. Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: BROADDRICK
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Also tonight, as we explain in the monologue President Trump severely punished Russia and its president the bad actor, that is Vladimir Putin today for poisoning the ex-spy and his daughter in Great Britain earlier this month. The president now ordered the expulsion of 60 Russian diplomats, some of whom are spies and closed the Russian consulate in Seattle. Joining us now with reaction, national security strategist and former deputy assistant to the president, Dr. Sebastian Gorka, and Catalina magazine publisher, Cathy Areu. Didn't we just hear from Brennan the former CIA director he would not take on Russia because they've got information on him, apparently not.

utterances.speaker: SEBASTIAN GORKA, NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGIST, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: You mean the same Brennan that voted for the Communist Party in 1976 that John Brennan, Sean?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's the guys, yes. If he was compromised the way Brennan said and then regurgitated Cathy's liberal friends in the media, sorry, Cathy.

utterances.speaker: CATHY AREU, PUBLISHER, CATALINA MAGAZINE
utterances.utterance: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Then I guess he wouldn't have -- he wouldn't do what he did today, would he?

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Sean, every single significant policy decision that President Trump has taken since January 20th of the inauguration has hurt Vladimir Putin. Whether it's unlocking the ANWR for oil expiration, the Excel pipeline, getting NATO after 30 years to finally commit to spending 2 percent of their GDP on defense, raising the defense budget, arming the Ukrainians. Every single one of them is bad for Vladimir, the former KGB officer. The left lives in a fantasy world. You know, the Max Boot, the John Brennans are ideologically never Trumpers. It's not about reality, it's about undermining a president, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Cathy, let me ask you, if John Brennan was right -- let me ask you this way.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Who was tough on Russia, Obama, Mr. Reset, Mr. Vladimir, tell Vladimir I'll do it after the election. I have more flexibility. Who was tougher on Russia, Donald Trump or Barack Obama and Hillary?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: So we really think that Donald Trump was tough on Russia. We think this tough doing what 24 other nations have done? This isn't enough.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Excuse me, Cathy, let me help educate your liberal mind. This will help you.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Because this is important.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you understand that by moving America towards energy independence he has literally cut the legs underneath Vladimir Putin?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: OK. And then what--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Literally that is the--

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: -- he's recently done congratulating Vladimir Putin.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- that is the only economic engine he has. That's it.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: So he had him on the phone and congratulated him and didn't mention anything about what happened to the spy in Britain.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Just like Barack Obama did in 2012.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: But had that happened, what happened in Britain to the spy, and his daughter is horrific. And that didn't happen on Obama's watch.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you a question.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: It happened on Trump's watch.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Was it -- was it wrong for Donald Trump to pay for a dossier on with Russian -- sorry, that was Hillary Clinton.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: I thought we were talking about getting tough on Russia.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: And I don't think Donald Trump is getting tough on Russia at all.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No. Hillary Clinton paid for the Russian dossier full of Russian government lies, Dr. Gorka.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Look, look at the track record of Obama and of his secretary of state Hillary Clinton. They rolled over when Vladimir Putin invaded another country. They sent this plastic reset button. They had the hot mic moment about flexibility. They closed down the missile deal with Central Europe that the president, the Italian president had promised to our NATO allies. The last administration facilitated the rise of Vladimir Putin.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: We don't even know what--

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: This will have Vladimir Putin by the neck.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: We don't even know what Trump had done for.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Are you joking me?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: We don't even know what Trump has done for Putin.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: You are in fantasy land.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: We have no -- I think you are in fantasy land. We have no idea what Trump has actually done for Putin. We may never even know--

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: So it's a conspiracy theory. So I give you a tinfoil hat because, you know, you don't know, well, nobody knows apart from you write--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: We do not -- we do not know yet.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Cathy, guys, one at a time.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: And that's why we're having an investigation going on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Dr. Sebastian Gorka?

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Look, at the end of the day it's about facts. The Russian economy is a one horse town. It depends on one thing. Oil and gas. That's it. Everything the president has done has hurt them at the core of their existence. They are in a death spiral economically and demographically. And anybody who denies that is an ideologue. It's as simple as that, Sean.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's simply diversion. Everything Trump has done is diversion. That's what it -- that's what it is.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you have any evidence after all those time of Trump Russia collusion that you can share with us, Cathy?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: Well, the investigation is going on so I can't to see what they find out.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you, it's been a year and four months.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you have any evidence at all?

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: So, we do have evidence of showing other--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you have any evidence -- well, Cathy, this is an easy question. Do you have any evidence of--

utterances.speaker: AREU
